page.title: 04SEARCH & RESCUE LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: The R.A.F. Search and Rescue service has been here in Lossiemouth since 1979. There are four people in a crew and they can take seventeen survivors in the helicopter. They have two Sea King helicopters which each have a range of 270 miles. The readiness time during the day is fifteen minutes but at night it is forty-five minutes. The team are on call twenty-four hours a day, every day. The main reason for having a Search and Rescue service is to rescue R.A.F. men who eject from a plane that they are flying. The service is called out to rescues about once every three days, about one hundred and twenty times a year. The other types of rescue they do are rescues in the mountains, particularily in winter, from the sea and from the cliffs.
